explanation: The reported violation is not correct for this function. The OS_strnlen implementation does use memchr(s, 0, maxlen) which can read up to maxlen bytes starting at s, so OS_strnlen is only safe when the caller supplies a maxlen that does not exceed the size of the underlying object (or the remaining size when s points into an object). In OS_FileSysStartVolume_Impl the call is vollen = OS_strnlen(local->volume_name, sizeof(local->volume_name)); here s points to the start of the array local->volume_name and maxlen is sizeof(local->volume_name) — these refer to the same object, so memchr cannot access beyond the bounds. Therefore this use does not violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17. (As a general note: if other call sites pass a pointer to an interior of a buffer together with the full buffer size, that would be a separate violation, but that is not the case in the shown code.)
